hints.content: Start by understanding the input format. The string 'rings' consists of color-position pairs where every two characters represent a ring's color and the rod it is placed on. For example, 'B0' means a blue ring on rod 0.

Consider how you can represent the rods and the colors of rings on them. You might want to use a data structure that allows you to keep track of which colors are present on each rod. A dictionary or an array could be useful here.
Think about how to iterate through the 'rings' string. Since the string has a length of 2n, you can loop through it in steps of 2 to extract each color and its corresponding rod.

As you process each color-position pair, update your data structure to reflect the presence of that color on the respective rod. For example, if you encounter 'R0', you would mark that rod 0 has a red ring.
Once you have populated your data structure, you need to check each rod to see if it contains all three colors. You can do this by checking the presence of 'R', 'G', and 'B' for each rod.
Consider edge cases, such as when there are fewer than three rings or when all rings are of the same color. How should your function handle these cases?
Remember that the rods are labeled from 0 to 9. Make sure your data structure can accommodate this range, and consider initializing it appropriately.
As you check each rod for the presence of all three colors, you can maintain a count of how many rods meet this criterion. This will be your final output.
When counting the rods with all three colors, ensure that you only increment your count when a rod has at least one of each color. You can use a simple condition to check this.
Finally, think about the return value of your function. You need to return the total count of rods that contain all three colors. Make sure your function returns this value correctly.

questionNotes: The input string 'rings' has a length of 2n, where n is the number of rings.
Each even index in the string represents a color ('R', 'G', 'B'), and each odd index represents a rod ('0' to '9').
You need to return the number of rods that have at least one ring of each color.
Consider edge cases where there are fewer than three rings or all rings are of the same color.
